item.title: Unit testing with coroutines
item.author: Author
item.description: The coroutines API has already brought some innovation in the Android and Kotlin world. I always loved the idea of keeping it as simple as we all can. There is a saying around here that “Whoever talks to much, makes too much mistakes” and I see this a little bit related to Java’s verbosity and also in the world of concurrency. It’s said over and over again that concurrency is not simple and I couldn’t agree more: You have to care about context, jobs running in parallel, cancelation, returning values etc.
